page.title: 13ST.JOHN'S CHURCH HIGH CROSS.
page.content: The parish of High Cross was formed in 1845 and the church of "St.John the Evangelist" was built by the local family of Giles-Puller (of Youngsbury) in 1847. Another local family;the Martin-Leakes' (of Marshalls);are also important names in its history.Since 1847 there have been 15 vicars.The church has 1 aisle and an arched arcade.There are many stained glass windows,2 of which are dedicated to the Martin-Leake family.A white ensign flag from the 1st World War (in which 25 villagers died) hangs in the nave.A new electronic organ has just been installed to replace the original pipe organ.Outside the church is the grave of Arthur Martin-Leake,who earned the V.C. both in the Boer and 1st World wars.The church has a "family area", where people can meet after services. It is well cared for and clean.
